articles.title: President of SPA Presidium Meets Koreans from Japan
articles.content:
President of SPA Presidium Meets Koreans from Japan
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk in an atmosphere overflowing with compatriotic feelings with an art troupe of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star led by Ha Yong Su at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Sunday.
					 Present there were Pae Jin Gu, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan who is heading the delegation of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Political Party Leader of Tajikistan
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Political Party Leader of Tajikistan
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan (CPT) who doubles as member of the House of Representatives of Tajikistan on Tuesday.
					 The message said:
					
					 The CPT extends warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to all the people of the DPRK on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il, outstanding leader of the Korean revolution and genuine fighter, who made a great contribution to the world communist movement.  
					
					 Please accept my regards.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Paektusan Prize Int'l Figure Skating Festival
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants in Paektusan Prize Int'l Figure Skating Festival
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un received a letter from Javier Martin Lopez on behalf of the International Elite Figure Skating Group and Vitaliy Nikiforov on behalf of the Ukrainian Figure Skating Team on Saturday, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The great Generalissimo Kim Jong Il is always alive in the hearts of the Korean and world progressive people for his exploits performed for the prosperity and happiness of the Korean people and for the cause of global independence, the letter said, and went on:
					
					 We will present demonstration performances at a high level to contribute to making the Day of the Shining Star more significant and letting the festival serve as an opportunity of boosting the friendship and cooperation among sports persons of different countries and further developing  figure skating technique.
					
					 We would like to sincerely wish you good health for the happiness and prosperity of the Korean people in the firm belief that the Korean people would achieve a great success in building the country into a prosperous and powerful one under your wise leadership.

articles.title: Messages, Letters to Kim Jong Un from Chongryon Organizations
articles.content:
Messages, Letters to Kim Jong Un from Chongryon Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received messages and letters from organizations of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They included the Standing Council of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, Central Standing Management Board of the Korean Youth Commercial Association in Japan, Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Teachers in Japan, Central Standing Council of the Union of Korean Educational Association in Japan, Central Standing Council of the Korean Scientists and Technologists Association in Japan, Central Standing Council of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, Standing Council of the Korean Sportsmen's Federation in Japan, Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Writers and Artists in Japan, Central Standing Council of the Korean Medical Association in Japan, Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Students in Japan, Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, Central
					
					  Standing Council of the Korean Human Rights Association in Japan and other Chongryon organizations and its affiliated organizations, Choson Sinbo Company, Korean  News Service, Hagu Bookshop, Kumgang-san Opera Troupe, Tonghae Ltd., Kumgang Insurance Company, Committee for Promoting Korea-Japan Economic Exchange, Federation of Joint Economic Venture of Korean Residents in Japan, Center for Consulting Marriage of Korean Youth in Japan, Korean Press Hall and other enterprises, local headquarters of Chongryon, Korea University and Korean schools at all levels in Japan.
					
					 The messages and letters said that Chongryon officials and Koreans in Japan are recollecting the feats of Kim Jong Il, who devoted his all to achieving the prosperity of the country and the happiness of its people and strengthening the movement of Koreans in Japan without a moment's rest.
					
					 His feats are shining long thanks to Kim Jong Un, they noted.
					
					 Chongryon officials and Koreans in Japan will firmly defend Chongryon organizations and conduct more dynamic patriotic activities, bearing deep in mind the noble idea and intention which are reflected in Kim Jong Un's New Year Address and New Year message, they stressed.
					
					 They wholeheartedly wished him good health for the eternal prosperity of the country and the strengthening of the movement of Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the consulate generals of China and Russia in Chongjin visited the mosaic portrait of smiling leader Kim Jong Il in Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province, on Saturday, to pay respects for him on the occasion of  his birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portrait and paid tribute to him.
					
					 Chinese residents in Chongjin City laid a floral basket before the portrait and made a bow that day.

articles.title: Overseas Compatriots Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Overseas Compatriots Visit Mangyongdae 
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Ho, vice-president of Yanbian University of Science and Technology of China, and Ri Yong Ho, managing director of Dandong Shengmin Trading Co. Ltd., China, and their parties visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. They are taking part in the 17th Kimjongilia Festival. 
					 They went round historic relics, being briefed on the glorious revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and his family members in Mangyongdae. 
					
					 Choe Ryong Ho said that Mangyongdae is the native home dear to the heart of the Koreans. 
					
					 Visit to Mangyongdae made me strongly miss Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, he said, adding:
					
					 The great Generalissimo devoted all his life to the prosperity of the country and people's happiness. 
					
					 The overseas Koreans also visited the National Gifts Exhibition House, Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, Rungna Dolphinarium, People's Open-air Ice Rink, etc.

articles.title: Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan Gives Performance for Guests of Honor
articles.content:
Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan Gives Performance for Guests of Honor
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The art troupe of Koreans in Japan gave a music and dance performance "Glorious Chongryon by Blessing of  Sun" for the guests of honor at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Sunday in celebration of the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.  
					 Enjoying the performance were Kim Yong Nam, Kim Ki Nam, officials concerned and people in the city.
					
					 Vice-Chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan Pae Jin Gu and his delegation of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star and other overseas compatriots and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front watched the performance.
					
					 The performance, which started with instrumental music and song "We Offer Glory to General", included solo dance and sohaegum (small Korean fiddle) solo "My Favorite Flower", male solo "Keeping His Instructions in Mind" and so on.
					
					 The performers sang of the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Jong Il, who was born as a bright star over Mt. Paektu and made devotion to the country and people throughout his life, and showed their ardent longings for him.
					
					 Jangsaenap solo "Hoeyang Nilliri", mixed chorus "Ongheya", narration and other numbers greatly excited the audience.
					
					 They sang of the epochal changes taking place one after another on the homeland which are attributable to the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un. The performance left deep impression on the audience.

articles.title: IIJI Director-General Interviewed by KCNA
articles.content:
IIJI Director-General Interviewed by KCNA 
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI) who doubles as secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and the International Kim Jong Il Prize Council, was interviewed by the Korean Central News Agency. He is visiting the DPRK to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The progressive mankind warmly congratulated the DPRK on its successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 into orbit last December, he said.
					
					 He stressed that the exercise of sovereignty is the legal and just right of an independent country.
					
					 The DPRK exercised its sovereignty according to international law on peaceful use of space. The U.S., however, branded the satellite launch as "a grave challenge" and got the UN Security Council cook up "a resolution on sanction", he added.
					
					 The National Defence Commission and Foreign Ministry of the DPRK flatly rejected the unwarranted "resolution" in their statements, he stressed, and went on:
					
					 The statements said that they will take certain physical counter measures of beefing up the military capabilities for self-defense including a nuclear deterrent.
					
					 The DPRK succeeded in the underground nuclear test on Feb. 12.
					
					 This shows the DPRK's stand of doing whatever it says will do.
					
					 It is quite illogical to say that the U.S. and its followers may launch satellites but DPRK can not launch and must even be exposed to "sanctions" if it does so.
					
					 He said he fully supports all the fair measures taken by the DPRK on behalf of groups for the study of the Juche idea and Juche idea followers.
					
					 The world conscience is full of confidence and will clearly witness, he stressed.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestler Wins Gold Medal at Int'l Wrestling Tournament
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestler Wins Gold Medal at Int'l Wrestling Tournament
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK wrestler Yang Kyong Il placed first in the men's 55 kg category freestyle wrestling event at an international wrestling tournament held in Bulgaria.
					 In the finals, Yang beat his Romanian rival, bagging the gold medal.
					
					 The tournament, which was opened on Feb. 15 in Plovdiv, Bulgaria, brought together excellent players from the DPRK, Russia, Romania, Poland and other countries.

articles.title: Int'l Figure Skating Festival Closes
articles.content:
Int'l Figure Skating Festival Closes
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The 22nd Paektusan Prize International Figure Skating Festival closed with due ceremony at the Ice Rink here on Sunday.
					 Present at the ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop, Ro Tu Chol and officials concerned, sportspersons and other people, delegations of overseas Koreans, overseas compatriots, the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front and foreign guests.
					
					 The prizes of the festival were awarded to players of Russia, Ukraine, Estonia, Canada and the DPRK who displayed high skills in the festival. 
					
					 Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, in his closing address referred to the fact that figure skaters of foreign countries displayed high skills and movements in deep reverence for leader Kim Jong Il, wishing for his immortality, and thus made contributions to celebrating the February holiday. 
					
					 He expressed belief that foreign friends and figure skaters would significantly celebrate the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) with the idea of independence, friendship and peace in the future, too. 
					
					 There were demonstration performances of figure skaters of foreign countries and the DPRK.

articles.title: Snowfalls in February Add to DPRK People's Yearning for Leader Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Snowfalls in February Add to DPRK People's Yearning for Leader Kim Jong Il 
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Korea has witnessed frequent snowfalls this month marking the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (February 16).
					 Such snowfalls remind the Korean people of the tireless efforts Kim Jong Il made for their happiness and the prosperity of the country.
					
					 In his lifetime he traveled a ceaseless journey of field guidance to all sectors of the country even under rains and snowfalls so as to provide the people with better living conditions. 
					
					 Out of his noble mission for the country and the people, he continued his journey of guidance until the last moments of his life, braving snowstorm.
					
					 It was January 1, Juche 86 (1997) when the leader visited the Mangyongdae Revolutionary School. It was heavily snowing that day.
					
					 Visiting the school, he said that it was the first time for him to see blizzard on the New Year's Day but it was a sign of good fortune.
					
					 He regarded it as his happiness to go through rainy and snowy storms for the rosy future of the country and the people.
					
					 That is why the people in the DPRK have sorely missed him and recalled his career, singing a song reflecting their wish that the leader would no longer go through heavy snow.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Condemns Japan's Suppression of Chongryon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Condemns Japan's Suppression of Chongryon 
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Sunday says Japan's additional "sanctions" amount to a grave challenge to the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK and an evil act going against human rights, humanitarianism and international law.
					 Japanese Prime Minister Abe, in a "statement" issued on February 12 in connection with the 3rd underground nuclear test of the DPRK, took additional "measures" of "banning the reentry" into Japan of the vice-chairmen of Chongryon (General Association of Korean Residents in Japan), claiming that they are "of the stand of rendering substantial help to the authorities of north Korea as their staff members".
					
					 The same day the right-wing gangsters of the ultra-right conservative organization of Japan flocked to the central hall of Chongryon and went on the rampage. They decried the nuclear test as "a threat to the world peace and security" and said "Koreans go out of Japan". The suspension of the application of the subsidies to the Korean schools took effect in a chain reaction in Kanagawa and Saitama prefectures and other areas of Japan.
					
					 It is the inveterate bad habit of the Japanese reactionaries to suppress and treat the Chongryon badly as sort of "hostages" in its bid to revenge on the DPRK, the commentary points out, and goes on:
					
					 Chongryon is a sacred overseas Koreans' organization representing and defending the Koreans' democratic and national rights. They live in Japan as a consequence of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea. 
					
					 It is an unacceptable barbaric act against humanity that the Japanese reactionaries keep clamping down on Koreans in Japan, far from guaranteeing their rights.
					
					 The DPRK will no longer overlook Japan escalating suppression and ill treatment of the dignified Chongryon and the compatriots in Japan but decisively react to them.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries Denounced for Coveting for Tok Islets
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries Denounced for Coveting for Tok Islets 
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Ichita Yamamoto, minister of territorial affairs of Japan, and Matsuda, chief of Okinoshima-cho in Shimane Prefecture of Japan, referred the Tok Islets issue to the government authorities in harsh tones. They said it was incomprehensible that an executive office for the issue of Tok Islets does not exist in the government, while justifying their acts by which they illegally "put the Tok Islets under the jurisdiction of Shimane Prefecture". They stressed the need to establish an office specializing in the Tok Islets issue in the Cabinet Office. 
					 A bylined commentary of Rodong Sinmun Sunday says that this indicates that the moves of the Japanese reactionaries for grabbing Tok Islets have now gone beyond the limit and reached the phase of organized implementation. The news analyst goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have so far kicked up a racket asserting Korea's territory as Japan's.
					
					 Now the denial of history and the moves for grabbing others' territories have become a trend in Japan. The Japanese reactionaries are denying the past crimes of Japan and hastening militarization of society, while using the issue of Tok Islets as an important means for inciting aggression, war and ultra-nationalism among Japanese people. 
					
					 They intend to instill the unjustified "dominium over Tok Islets" into younger generations, incite militarism and provide social conditions for overseas aggression. 
					
					 Their persistent territorial claim to Tok Islets will bring them a self-destruction. 
					
					 The ultra-right forces of Japan should not resort to the moves for grabbing Tok Islets but redress the huge crimes of past committed against the Korean people. 
					
					 The Japanese militarists will get nothing from its assertion of "dominium over Tok Islets".

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Denounces Japan for Tightening Sanctions on Koreans
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Denounces Japan for Tightening Sanctions on Koreans 
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- After the 3rd underground nuclear test in the DPRK, the suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Koreans in Japan has become harsher at the direct connivance and under patronage of the Japanese government. 
					 Japanese Prime Minister Abe issued a "statement" which said that "Japan will not allow the reentry into Japan of the vice-chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon who made a passage to the DPRK" as part of "additional sanctions" against it. 
					
					 In another development, gangs of Japan and right-wing reactionaries flocked to the Chongryon Central Headquarters where they shouted "We protest against north Korea's nuclear test" and "Koreans, go out of Japan".
					
					 Saitama and Kanagawa prefectures unhesitatingly cancelled the plan for the payment of grants-in-aid for Korean schools in the prefectures. 
					
					 In the present highly-civilized world, the Japanese authorities mobilized the state power and even incited gangs to suppress overseas citizens of a sovereign state. This is despicable political gangsterism which should be severely punished by world conscience. 
					
					 Visits to homeland and democratic national education are elementary human rights which should be granted to Koreans in Japan under international law. 
					
					 During the Second World War, the Japanese imperialists forcefully drafted lots of Koreans to Japan to force them into slave labor. Japan, a war criminal state, has bounden moral and legal duties to ensure legitimate rights for their descendents in Japan. 
					
					 There are many countries which have overseas organizations. There is no such rogue state as Japan in the world as it deprived the overseas Koreans' organization and its officials of the elementary rights to visits, and has enforced national discrimination policy and openly made political blackmail against young schoolchildren to take revenge on the state to which it is hostile. 
					
					 Now conscientious Japanese of the elder generation say that even the UN urged Japan to stop discrimination and that they can not but feel shame of the authorities' harsh and base suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan when comparing it with the DPRK government's policy for the Japanese people and schools just after Japan's defeat. 
					
					 As was recollected by them, after the defeat of Japan the Japanese in Korea received humanitarian treatment though they were citizens of a war criminal state, which is quite contrary to the treatment of the Koreans in Japan at present. 
					
					 Japanese authorities have imposed sufferings upon Koreans in Japan generation after generation, far from repaying for favor in kind. This criminal act should be referred to the international court and settled. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should behave themselves. 
					
					 The suppression of Chongryon, legitimate overseas citizens organization of the DPRK, and Koreans in Japan is another wanton violation of the sovereignty of the DPRK and it can never be tolerated. 
					
					 Koreans in Japan have the invincible homeland with powerful national strength. 
					
					 The homeland will always stand by the overseas citizens. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries will have to pay dearly for the step taken by them.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers to Stage War Maneuvers
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers to Stage War Maneuvers
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The Seventh Airlifting Brigade of the south Korean puppet army on Feb. 15 announced that it would stage military exercises to cope with the all-out action in areas of Iksan and Wanju, North Jolla Province, south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					 The warmongers said the military exercises will last till Feb. 21 to confirm the performance of operation and capacity for coordinated operation among civilian and administration officials and police and increase the capability to cope with a real war.
					
					 It was reported that troops, vehicles, planes and other huge armed forces would be involved in the drills.
					
					 The saber-rattling aimed at the infiltration into the DPRK in contingency on the Korean Peninsula reveals the belligerent scenario of the warmongers.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Stop "Sanctions" Racket against DPRK: S. Korean Organization
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Stop "Sanctions" Racket against DPRK: S. Korean Organization
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea on Feb. 14 made public a statement urging the U.S. to stop at once the "sanctions" racket against the DPRK. 
					 The statement said that the situation of the Korean Peninsula has reached the brink of a war owing to the U.S. heinous racket for "sanctions" against the DPRK. 
					
					 Several countries launched satellites this year, but the U.S. subjected the DPRK only to "sanctions", it said, adding that the U.S. can not get any understanding from any south Korean. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The U.S. behavior can not but be interpreted as the moves to tide over the crisis by igniting a war on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The situation will get more serious if the U.S. does not drop the hostile policy towards the north, the statement warned.
					
					 It called upon all the people desirous of peace, national reconciliation and cooperation to turn out in an action against the U.S. ferocious racket of "sanctions" and war moves.

articles.title: S. Korean Army Announces Plan to Stage War Exercise
articles.content:
S. Korea Announces Plan to Stage War Exercise 
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Unit 6953 of the south Korean puppet army announced that it will stage exercise in the Mugon-ri area of Phaju City, Kyonggi Province, from Feb. 18 to 28, according to south Korean Yonhap News. 
					 The warmongers plan to hurl massive armed forces, military vehicles, tanks and other war equipment into the exercise. 
					
					 The Korean nation will severely punish the warmongers for their reckless action of driving the situation of the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war by waging ceaseless anti-north exercises in the forefront area.

articles.title: Organization of Koreans in China Denounces S. Korean Authorities for Fascist Action
articles.content:
Organization of Koreans in China Denounces S. Korean Authorities for Fascist Action 
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of Koreans in China of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) on Feb. 11 made public a statement to condemn the south Korean regime for its fascist suppression of members of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon.
					 The statement said that Vice-Chairman Ro Su Hui's visit to the north was prompted by his conscience and sense of obligation to express profound condolences over the unexpected loss of Kim Jong Il, father of the nation, who ushered in the June 15 era for independence and national reunification and led all the fellow countrymen to the way of reunification. 
					
					 The fascist action by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is a blatant challenge to all the Koreans desirous of national reconciliation and reunification of the country and an unpardonable traitorous and anti-reunification act as it frantically incited confrontation with compatriots, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Traitor Lee will surely be made to pay for his crimes that stemmed from treachery and confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should abolish the traitorous and fascist "Security Law" and immediately release the vice-chairman and other pro-reunification patriots. 
					
					 The Headquarters of Koreans in China of Pomminryon will stage stronger actions to wipe out the traitorous group as early as possible.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Mark Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Mark Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- A meeting of Koreans in Japan took place at the Korean Hall of Culture in Tokyo on Saturday, the 71st birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were Chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) Ho Jong Man, Vice-Chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee Nam Sung U, Vice-Chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee and concurrently Chairman of the National Rights Committee Pae Ik Ju, Vice-Chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee Ko Tok U, Vice-Chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee and concurrently Chairman of its Rights and Welfare Committee Pak Ku Ho and Chairman of the Central Audit Committee of Chongryon Hong In Hum. Advisors, department directors, vice-chairmen of committees  of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, the permanent advisor and the director of the Research Institute on History of Korean Residents in Japan, leading officials of Chongryon organizations and enterprises in Tokyo, chairmen of Chongryon headquarters and Chongryon officials and compatriots in Kanto area, teacher
					
					 s and students of Joson University also attended.
					
					 Ho Jong Man in his report said that Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was an outstanding leader of Chongryon and a tender-hearted father who ushered in the era of happiness for Koreans in Japan as well as the bright future for the rising generations.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, who always took warm care of Chongryon, led it and clearly indicated the way to be followed by the movement of Koreans in Japan, Ho noted, and went on:
					
					 To hold him in high esteem as the eternal sun will provide the ideological mainstay to Chongryon officials and Koreans in Japan just as the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un mentioned in his New Year address, and it is the strong sense of moral obligation they can not go back on no matter how much water may flow under the bridge and how many generations are replaced with another.
					
					 Though he was busy with leading the Juche cause, Kim Jong Un has shown all benevolence for Chongryon and Koreans in Japan just as Kim Jong Il did.
					
					 However grim the situation may be and however desperately the reactionaries at home and abroad may try, we will deepen the faith in Juche and consolidate the single-minded unity of the ranks as firm as a rock and thus defend Kim Jong Un and further strengthen Chongryon into the world level overseas Koreans organization remaining loyal to his leadership.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was read out at the meeting.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Give Art Performance in Celebration of Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Give Art Performance in Celebration of Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary 
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- An art performance in celebration of the 71st birth anniversary of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was given at the Korean Hall of Culture in Tokyo on Saturday. 
					 It began with chorus of the immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Jong Il" and "Ode to Comrade Kim Jong Il" by students of Korea University. They sang in deep reverence for and with strong yearning for the Generalissimo. 
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers like male solo "Ah, General", jangsaenap solo "Attraction and Reverence" and "Arirang for Prosperity" and female duet "Song of Our Lives". 
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the feats of Kim Jong Il, who took warm care of Koreans in Japan and led their movement. 
					
					 They showed peculiar band music of serial songs "The Victorious Parade", "Footsteps" and "Our Leader Loved by the People", reflecting the ardent will of loyalty to the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The performance ended with chorus "The General Will Live Forever as the Sun".
					
					 It was enjoyed by officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and other Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: Chongryon Central Photo Show Held in Japan
articles.content:
Chongryon Central Photo Show Held in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- A Chongryon (General Association of Korean Residents in Japan) Central Photo Show took place at the Tokyo Korean middle and high school in Japan to mark the 71st anniversary of birth of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 On display in the venue were photos documenting the revolutionary career and leadership feats of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, who ushered in a heyday of the revolutionary cause of Juche, his loving care for Chongryon and Koreans in Japan and his Songun revolutionary leadership provided together with the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The photos on show also deal with the tireless leadership provided by Kim Jong Un by leading to victory the construction of a thriving nation and the confrontation with the U.S. while always going among the people in order to bring into a reality the grand intention and desire of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present there were Chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon Ho Jong Man, Vice-Chairman Nam Sung U, Vice-Chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee and concurrently Chairman of the National Rights Committee Pae Ik Ju, Vice-Chairman Ko Tok U, Vice-Chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee and concurrently Chairman of its Rights and Welfare Committee Pak Ku Ho and Chairman of the Central Audit Committee of Chongryon Hong In Hum. 
					
					 Also attending the event were advisors, department directors, vice-chairmen of committees of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, the permanent advisor and the director of the Research Institute on History of Korean Residents in Japan, leading officials of Chongryon organizations and enterprises and chairmen of Chongryon headquarters in Kanto. They looked round the photos on show.

articles.title: Seminar Held by Korean Social Scientists in Japan
articles.content:
Seminar Held by Korean Social Scientists in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- A seminar of Korean social scientists in Japan was held at the Korean Press Hall in Tokyo on Feb. 14 to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Speeches were made on the themes of "On strategic plan clarified by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un in his historic New Year Address for Juche 102 (2013)", "The present situation and prospect in 2013 for building an economic giant" and "On essence and prospect of the situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula".
					
					 Speakers said that upon receiving with great excitement the New Year Address and New Year message of Kim Jong Un, all the officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and Koreans in Japan are renewing their resolution to implement his grand plan and intention in all fields.
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address clarified a strategic plan to open an epochal phase in building a thriving socialist country and a reunified thriving country and turn the DPRK into the most powerful country in the world this year, they said.
					
					 The DPRK has made great progress in building an economic giant and improving the standard of people's living despite the enemy's "sanctions" and pressure, they noted, adding that the DPRK's economy will make big progress as it has already laid a foundation for the independent national economy.
					
					 They recalled that the DPRK launched an all-out action to defend the sovereignty of the country and nation and shatter the moves of the U.S. and other hostile forces to isolate and stifle it.
					
					 They urged the U.S. and neighboring countries to face up to the present situation and opt for improving the relations with the DPRK.
					
					 Present at the seminar were Ko Tok U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, Kim Hwa Hyo, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, members of the association, leading officials of Chongryon organizations and enterprises in Tokyo, teachers of Joson University, and Chongryon officials and Koreans in Kanto area.

articles.title: Seminar Held by Korean Social Scientists in Japan
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked in Uzbekistan
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The "Old Men" Association for Korean Cultural Tradition in Uzbekistan held a meeting and photo show in celebration of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il at the office building of the association on Feb. 12.
					 Chairman of the Association Ju Yong Il, heads of the art groups of Koreans abroad and Koreans in Uzbekistan attended.
					
					 Ju Yong Il in the meeting made an address which said:
					
					 Generalissimo Kim Jong Il performed great feats in all fields of politics, military affairs and economy with his tireless Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Particularly he developed the DPRK into a nuclear weapons state and a satellite manufacturing and launching state, demonstrating the might of country.
					
					 His cause is being credibly carried forward by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un and the national reunification has a promising bright future.
					
					 Last year Kim Jong Un made sure that shining achievements were made in the country with his politics of love for people and wise leadership.
					
					 The speaker called upon all the compatriots to get united close under the banner of June 15 joint declaration and arise to make a turn in the effort for Korea's reunification. 
					
					 The meeting was followed by the photo show.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Romanian Paper
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The gist of leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party" was carried by the Romanian newspaper Romania Muncitoare on February 10.
					 The work, published on January 3, Juche 81 (1992), clarifies that a historic lesson drawn from socialist construction is that it is necessary to steadily strengthen the driving force for revolution with faith in socialism and a correct guiding idea, adhere to the principle of socialism and strengthen the comradely unity and cooperation based on independence.
					
					 The work expounds on the idea that it is the general line of the Workers' Party of Korea for building socialism to strengthen the people's government and increase its function and role and thoroughly carry out the three revolutions -- ideological, technical and cultural. The work also explains the validity of the idea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Mexico
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" was published in booklet on February 7 by the Publishing House of the Workers' Party of Mexico.
					 The work, issued on April 6, Juche 101 (2012) clarifies that it is the principled demand for victoriously advancing the Korean revolutionary cause to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea forever, and indicates the tasks for constantly strengthening and developing the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Meetings and a film show took place in Mexico, Bulgaria and Italy in the period between February 8 and 11 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 On display in the venues of the events were photos on Songun leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il and exploits of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were books and photos introducing the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					 Participants of the film show watched Korean film "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".
					
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, said in his speech that Kim Jong Il was a distinguished thinker and theoretician and a peerless Songun brilliant commander who led the revolutionary cause of Juche to victory, and an ardent patriot and leader of the people whose revolutionary career had been characterized by the devotion to the country and people.
					
					 Milcho Gyuvrov, chairman of the Bulgarian Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, noted that Kim Jong Il developed the Workers' Party of Korea into an ever-victorious party in which all its members are united as one on the basis of the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung, and devoted his life to the freedom and happiness of the people, friendship among the peoples and the global cause of independence.
					
					 Marco Rizzo, general secretary of the Leftwing People's Party of Communists of Italy, noted that Kim Jong Il was an outstanding leader of the global socialist movement and a political elder who performed immortal feats in the history of human thinking and socialist reconstruction movement.
					
					 I firmly believe that the Korean people would achieve a final victory in building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, he stressed.
					
					 A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in Bulgaria.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by IIJI Director-General
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by IIJI Director-General
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI), paid his noblest respect to leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his 71st birth anniversary.
					 Vishwanath who doubles as secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and the International Kim Jong Il Prize Council released a statement on February 8.
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il was an illustrious leader of socialist Korea and brilliant successor of President Kim Il Sung's idea and cause, he said, adding: Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary serves as the greatest auspicious holiday common to not only the Korean people but other progressive people.
					
					 Kim Jong Il developed the Workers' Party of Korea into a party serving the people and a vanguard organization enjoying full trust from the people in the socialist cause and provided a firm foundation for building a thriving nation wisely leading the Korean people, he stressed.
					
					 Kim Jong Il firmly defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country frustrating the moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK by pursuing the unique Songun politics.
					
					 Vishwanath praised the exploits Kim Jong Il performed for the cause of national reunification.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un with a strong sense of moral obligation for HE Kim Jong Il made sure that February 16, birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il, was instituted as the Day of the Shining Star, he said.
					
					 He vowed to join progressive people respecting Kim Jong Il in holding more active solidarity activities supporting the implementation of the inter-Korean joint declaration while disclosing and denouncing the moves of the U.S. and allies to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 Availing himself of the opportunity, he reaffirmed his full support to the just cause of the Korean people who turned out in the all-out action for defending the dignity and sovereignty of the country.
					
					 He said he was convinced that the Korean people who hold Kim Jong Un in high esteem would achieve great successes in the efforts for building a thriving nation and achieving national reunification.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Test Supported in Pakistan, France
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Test Supported in Pakistan, France
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- Pakistani and French public organizations released statements in support of the 3rd underground nuclear test in the DPRK on Feb. 12.
					 The Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association sent the most sincere congratulations to the heroic DPRK people on their success in the 3rd underground nuclear test that demonstrated the dignity and might of Songun Korea.
					
					 The Association said it regards the nuclear test as an event of great significance which makes it possible for the DPRK to protect its high interests and dignity from the preemptive attack, threats, sanctions and pressure by the U.S. under the serious situation blamed on the U.S. and its followers.
					
					 The nuclear test encourages all the DPRK army and people in their efforts to build a thriving nation under the banner of Songun and safeguards the sovereignty of the DPRK and the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula as well, the Association said in a statement.
					
					 It expressed belief that the DPRK people would win a final victory under the wise leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, upholding the banner of Songun.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association said:
					
					 The U.S. and the West claim that the nuclear test in the DPRK is in violation of the UN Security Council's "resolution", and a challenge.
					
					 We support the DPRK that has carried out the nuclear test to defend the dignity and sovereignty to cope with the U.S. and other hostile forces trying hard to stifle it.
					
					 We call upon the progressive and peace-loving forces across the world to be greatly concerned about the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Dialogue and negotiations are the only way for averting war and guaranteeing the lasting peace and stability.
					
					 We will conduct wide-ranging solidarity activities including the worldwide signature campaign for the conclusion of a peace treaty on the Korean Peninsula in support of the Koreans' just cause.

articles.title: Mauritanian Political Party Leader Hopes for Improving Friendly Relations with WPK
articles.content:
Mauritanian Political Party Leader Hopes for Improving Friendly Relations with WPK
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- I congratulate the Korean people for achieving successes in building an economic power under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 The chairman of the Union for the Mauritanian Republic said this when meeting Hwang Hyong Chol, DPRK ambassador to Mauritania, who paid a courtesy call on Feb. 5.
					
					 The two countries and the two parties have developed the friendly and cooperative relations for a long time since their establishment, the chairman noted.
					
					 The chairman voiced his willingness to make positive efforts to boost the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties.

articles.title: News of DPRK's Underground Nuclear Test Reported Abroad
articles.content:
News of DPRK's Underground Nuclear Test Reported Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, February 17 (KCNA) -- The news that the DPRK successfully conducted the third underground nuclear test was reported in various countries between February 12 and 14.
					 The Myanmar News Agency said under the title "The DPRK has conducted the third nuclear test":
					
					 The DPRK announced on Feb. 12 that it conducted the third underground nuclear test.
					
					 The Korean Central News Agency said in its report that the nuclear test was conducted as part of substantial counter-measures for protecting the country's security and sovereignty against the outrageous U.S. hostile acts of having wantonly violated the DPRK's legitimate right to satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The report said that the nuclear test was carried out in a safe and perfect manner at the highest level by use of a miniaturized and lighter A-bomb unlike the previous ones, yet with great explosive power and it was confirmed that it had no negative impact on the surrounding ecological environment.
					
					 The specific features of the function and explosive power of the A-bomb and all other measurements fully tallied with the values of the design, physically demonstrating the good performance of the DPRK's nuclear deterrence that has become diversified, the report added.
					
					 Various other media reported the same news.
					
					 They included the Russian internet magazines Mar 12, Hanber Journal, internet homepages of the Far Eastern Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Moscow Workers' Union and other internet homepages of Russia, the Cuban paper Granma, the Vietnamese Central TV, the Nepal Today, the Algerie Presse Service, an internet paper and an internet website of Ukraine and the internet website of the Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK.
